column4: is anyone experiencing intermittent wifi connection issues on oneiric 64-bit?  I have an rt61pci-based linksys card on wpa-psk personal
I am indeed ! but I'm 32 bit. any chance one of your partitions is remounting itself?
usually my connection is good, but sometimes it drops out and firefox keeps trying to "look up" a URL rather than just go to it
and sometimes I have to try my WPA-PSK passkey several times b4 I get an IP
do you use WPA, WEP, or any other security on your wifi
yes, yes, and yes. i have the same issues. sometimes i have to turn off wireless and then back on before it works again
the only thing I ever see in the log files when my connection fails is along the lines of "deauthentication (reason 6)"
I'm not sure what reason 6 means when it comes to failed authentication
maybe it's different for different wireless drivers/cards?
possible.. honestly don't know. it's actually why I'm here right now
I wish there was some way to contact the people that code the kernel modules for wifi cards.
what module does your card use?
I have fond memories of using ndiswrapper for getting broadcoms to work under Ubuntu lol
funny.. i have memories, but they're not fond :P
